reviewText:
***Updated Version of Dark Souls 2, including all DLCs, slightly better graphics and some Gameplay changes.***

As always this review is just my own opinion and what I think about this game. If you notice any mistakes I made (apart from grammar mistakes) feel free to report them in the comments.

Story:
While you play through Dark Soul 2, you will notice that there is not much of a Story, except for the Player waking up in a strange field and fighting his way through hordes of monsters and undead. That is because you will have to talk to the people, look at your surroundings and read item descriptions to get pieces, with which you can unravel the past of Lordran, Drangleic and the Curse of the Undead. Once you get yourself to read and listen carefully, you will notice that the Story is mysterious, complex and very interesting.

Gameplay:
You die. A lot. But you probably know that already. Apart from that, the combat system is the essence of this game and boy is it good. Wether you play with a Greatsword, a Lance or a Staff, fast and intense fights that also require some tactics are guaranteed and bosses that will sometimes leave you sleepless, because you just have to try for the 20th time to kill that f*cker, are common. The level system (collecting souls from enemies to level up), bonfires that serve as checkpoints and the strange inhabitants of Lordran fit good in the world of Dark Souls 2.

Graphics:
While the graphics really are not too good, it sure looks beautiful wandering around in old ruins, along steep cliffs and jump into deep holes. The lights and shadows also look stunning most of the time, but some sharper textures would not do any harm. The overall performance is good and not laggy at all, but 60 FPS is the max. you can get.

Sound:
The game uses the right background music in the right environments and the sounds while fighting are realistic and epic too. It also has some creepy soundtracks that really fit the dark nature of the game.

Content:
As said before, this game includes Dark Souls 2 and its three DLCs (Crown of the Ivory/Iron/Sunken King). There are a lot of areas to explore and you probably have to retry some parts because you die. Depending on how fast and skilled you are, the game offers about 50-80 hours of challenges and dying. There is also a NG+ (and NG++, NG+++,... for that matter) which offers stronger enemies (and even some new ones), some new items and bosses have some unseen special moves.

Multiplayer:
People can enter your session randomly at certain places and challenge you, but you can also invade other players yourself, help them defeat bosses or duel against each other. Matchmaking is determined by the total number of collected souls, so fights wonÂ´t be too unfair, but sometimes being invaded is just annoying. If you enjoy the Multipayer, it can easily add 30 more hours to your overall playtime.

Conclusion:
Dark Souls 2:  Scholar of the First Sin is a dark and mysterious RPG for people who like RPGs, dark fantasy worlds and games that are a bit harder than the rest. Even if you donÂ´t like these things you should give this game a try, but just if you donÂ´t mind dying over and over again.

Praise the Sun!

reviewText: For anyone concerned that this game will be too hard for them, don't be. The game is difficult, yes, but it's hard in a fair way. For example, if you're stuck on one level, you always have the option to go somewhere else for now. If you're having trouble with a boss, the problem isn't that you need to grind or that you need better equipment but that your technique needs to be aultered. Yes, traps can kill you in one hit, but you will have warning. My advise? Talk to every NPC until every dialogue option is exhausted. The simplest of NPC's can give you items essential to progressing the story. Don't run to wiki as soon as you can't figure something out. This isn't the kind of game where you have to use the sandwich on the elevator to get the goldfish to talk to you; yes, there are puzzles and they are very solvable if you try. Pay attention! Learn when to dodge and when to swing, when to leave and cash out your souls, where to go to for upgrades, and so on.
